title.narrative: National Program Support for Environment and Natural Resources Management Project

description.narrative: The program's overall development objective is to assist the Department of Environment and Natural Resources to improve efficiency and effectiveness in its service delivery. More specifically, the project would aim to strengthen the allocative efficiency of DENR's limited budget resources through better prioritization and partnership arrangements, facilitating scaling-up and better linking of plans and budgets.

provider-org.narrative: International Bank for Reconstruction and Development

condition.narrative: Borrower through DENR shall complete implementation of the recommendations in its 2005 audit report in accordance with theFinancial Management Action Plan, in a manner satisfactory to the Bank.
By 06/30 & 12/31 of each CY, strtng 06/30/08, conduct semi-annual intrnl audits for Proj.accnts in scope & details acceptable toBank & thereafter furnish a rprt to Bank with its fndngs & recmmndtns.
Develop and immediately thereafter implement an action plan to improve DENR's information management system (MIS) and the publicaccess to DENR's information database.
Engage an external firm, with qualifications and experience and under terms of reference, acceptable to the Bank, to strengthenDENR's internal audit services.
Implement the aforementioned three (3) year forward-looking planning and budgeting strategy taking into account the Bank'scomments thereon.
Issue & thereafter implmnt an administrtve order to establish a procremnt unit within DENR, under TOR consistent with therequirements of the Borrower's Procurement Reform Act (Republic Act 9184).
Issue and thereafter implement an administrative order to enable its Internal Audit unit to report directly to the Secretary ofDENR, in line with the Borrower's anti-corruption initiatives.
Issue and thereafter implement an administrative order to restructure its Environment Management Bureau (EMB) and to staff therestructured EMB, all in accordance with DENR's Rationalization Plan.
Prep 3 yr plan/budget strategy with reform benchmarks in, PA/ENV/NRM/ abandoned mines rehab/ etc
Review with Bank the mid-term evaluation report and take all measures required to ensure the efficient completion of the projectand achievement of objectives.
Undertake a baseline study to measure client satisfaction with DENR's service delivery.
Undertake a follow-up study to baseline study to compare the effectiveness of measures undertaken by DENR during the Projectperiodto improve client satisfaction in regard to its service delivery.
furnish to the Bank, not later than March 31 in each year starting March 31, 2008 for review and comments, an annual work plan andbudget for the implementation of the project in the following year
prepare under TOR satisfactory to the Bank, and furnish to the Bank a mid-term evaluation report integrating the results of themonitoring and evaluation activities performed.

title.narrative: 106,000 hectares of protected areas, protection forest and wetlands in GEF supported sites under effective management by PY5 as measured by the PA management effectiveness tool

comment.narrative: Baseline being estimated as part of the Client Satisfaction Survey that is being implemented.
Core indicator equivalent (forest area brought under effective management) METT implemented in PAs in all GEF sites though only131,886 ha. covered

title.narrative: 35% of ecologically sensitive forests (outside protected areas) under effective protection as identified in each WMP

comment.narrative: Baseline being estimated as part of the Client Satisfaction Survey that is being implemented.

title.narrative: Implementation of DENR's reform agenda, which includes timely actions on the dated covenants, achievement of the key milestones andcontinued progress in implementing the Rationalization Plan

baseline.value: Reform Agenda agreed for NPS-ENRMP in line with Rationalization Plan. Dated covenants provided in the loan for key actions.

target.value: Key milestones have been met Dated loan covenants complied with and under implementation.

comment.narrative: Partially Achieved: EMB, MGB, NAMRIA & DENR Rat Plan still pending DBM approval, but reforms generally in line with planRationalization Plan. The final approval is beyond DENR's control as the same situation applies to other agencies, thus theindicator may not be fully achieved at project closing.

title.narrative: Framework for the rationalization of NRM&E policies and legislation developed and under implementation

baseline.value: Various studies available highlighting inconsistencies in legislation, policy and implementation

target.value: Action plan being implemented to rationalize the ENR policies and legislation

comment.narrative: Framework developed and being updated in line with new priorities

title.narrative: 80% of the Project's investment targets in rehabilitation, ecosystem development and assessments being met

comment.narrative: Achieved: LGUs have CAF for 88% of $4m GEF grant. Balance expected to be completed soon

title.narrative: Forward planning and budgeting strategy started to be implemented which inter alia provides a vision and benchmarks for key reformsin DENRs operations

baseline.value: DBM instruction has been isused requiring OPIFs to be prepared by all departments

target.value: Close linkage between Plans and Budgets

comment.narrative: 2010-2012 Medium Term Expenditure Program by sector was completed.

title.narrative: Procedures and responsibilities for issuance of tenure instruments standardized and streamlined

baseline.value: Lack of clarity in procedures for CBRMA/CBFMA and NIPAS has virtually resulted in a cessation of this instrument

target.value: Increases in issuance of CBRMA/CBFMAs and NIPAS-IRR

title.narrative: 60% of targeted communities in GEF supported sites implementing micro-catchment plans by the end of the Project

comment.narrative: All targeted municipalities have micro catchment plans

title.narrative: 128 LGUs are implementing three aspects of ecological solid waste management

comment.narrative: Core indicator equivalent (Industrial or municipal solid waste reduced or recycled under the project) Out of 112 LGUs, 88%implementing segregation at source; 84% practice segregated collection, and 78% operate MRFs. 3 LGUs exempted due to impact ofdisasters

title.narrative: 100% of GEF supported protected areas (PA) mainstreamed PA management effectiveness tool

baseline.value: Tools not in use at any sites

comment.narrative: Core indicator equivalent (Forest area brought under management plans) Tool in use at all sites

title.narrative: Designation and operationalization of at least 3 water quality management areas

comment.narrative: 3 WQMAs established i) Meycauayan-Marilao-Obando- R3, Jaro-Tigum-Aganan R-6 & Saranggani Bay-R12. Each has a Governing Board and10- year WQMA action plan.

title.narrative: 75 % of funded activities (by $ value) in GEF supported sites implemented by the LGUs and/or other stakeholders

comment.narrative: Core indicator equivalent (people in targeted forest and adjacent communities with increased monetary and non-monetary benefitsfrom forests)

title.narrative: 30% improvement in overall client satisfaction with DENR service delivery by type of client e.g. LGU/communities.

comment.narrative: Follow up survey to be conducted in October 2013

title.narrative: 10% per annum increase in companies complying with environmental standards compared to baseline

comment.narrative: Core indicator equivalent (Particulate matter reduction under the project (microgram/m3))

title.narrative: 30% of degraded forest in GEF supported sites rehabilitated with native species representing the bio-geographic region as identified in the WMP

comment.narrative: Core indicator: area restored. Rehab. Of 9525 ha (planned target may have been over estimated given available resources)
